title: If Illoai can Pull Spirits from Their Bodies could She Pull Senna from Thresh's Lantern?
body: Or is there an enchantment that negates external forces acting on the spirits contained within?

replies.body: She does not pull souls out. Just spirits. Riot has made sure to point out there is a difference between the two
I suppose that answers my question.

I think it depends on how you define soul and spirit.

My personal answer would be that **spirits** do have *souls*. As I understand it, **Spirit** is an incorporeal manifestation, whereas _soul_ is an ethereal essence of one's existence. **Spirits** tend to be bound, but don't have to be, to a body, while a _soul_ serves as a matrix for one's psyche. In case a **spirit** wasn't bound to a material anchor, or was independent on it, it could be possible for it to have a _soul_. In the end, the two terms are often understood as synonyms and tend to be interchanged rather freely, which brings me back to my primary statement.

_Note: I tried to answer the question academically, because, damn, am I a meddlesome bore. However, English isn't my mother tongue, so there's quite a possibility I screwed some meaning up. In the end, I hope my response is clear enough to enlighten you. :)_
he can pull a spirits out of teemo so demons can be removed of their spirits too

I need some Spectral-101 classes because I always thought they were the same.

Soul -> when inside body.
Spirit -> soul of a being wondering around.
Ghost -> soul of a being haunting around.

there are more names i don't remember now

That would probably depend on the power levels between the two. Is Illoai strong enough to rip away a spirit from its captor, or is Thresh's dominating will too much for her to overcome? After all, ripping a spirit from an unsuspecting and undefended body is (relatively) simple enough. Taking it from someone who knows how to toy with souls, and is loath to give them up, is another matter entirely.

It poses an interesting conundrum, after all, Illaoi is shown to be nothing more than a mortal spreading the teachings of Nagakabouros and Thresh is an eternal specter of cruelty and malice, but Nagakabouros is beyond both, if limited by a lack of manifestation in the physical world.

The circumstances are stacked in Thresh's favor, but Shadow and Fortune proves that Illaoi can impact the dead, or at the very least turn them away.

Illaoi is merely a conduit and a physical anchor for Nagakabouros. That's what her job entails.

However, she can only turn back the Mist, which protects the dead. She made it clear that the way to fight back against death is motion, because moving, learning, adapting... it's the best way to survive. Nagakabouros may be a harsh god, but a god that is willing to save those who are trapped in the endless and unnatural cycle of undeath, where beings are always dying but never truly die. It's painful.

Thresh can easily tear any oerson's spirit from their physical form. Nagakabouros can do the same, but motion is the only way to escape. That's why Thresh holds his victims still with chains.

Thresh takes Souls
